author: David Chaltas
text: They rest in the land that they love
Looking down from heaven above.
But their spirit still lingers;
I feel the touch of their fingers
Surrounding me like hands in a glove.
At times I can sense the battle.
I can hear their sabers rattle.
The moaning and the crying!
The echoes of the dying,
As men fall out of their saddles!
The land is now one with their blood
Entwined with the rivers of mud.
But their spirits can be found
Walking on that hallowed ground
Where the crimson flowed like a flood.
They linger with special power
To remind us of the hour
When we fought one another.
It was brother against brother
When the thorns bloomed instead of flowers.
It's our post to help seek their quest
For they offered our land their best.
We must always remember
Their ultimate surrender
In the land that they loved, they rest.
title: They Rest in the Land That They Loved
